page.title: 15The Bollin Valley.
page.content: The main physical geographical feature of the survey area is the River Bollin.The river flows north-west until it reaches the River Mersey. In the past,the river has been badly polluted but,recently,local conservation groups and community awareness has retrieved the situation. For many years,various species of birds,animals and fishes were absent from the river,but have now returned. A Bollin Valley Project was begun in order to enable people to discover the Bollin Valley landscape and heritage, by walking its countryside,villages and towns.During the summer of 1985 various guided walks took place,led by voluntary leaders from various societies in the area.It is hoped to continue and enlarge the project in 1986.
